posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment

posts.title: test-post
posts.text: Test Post HexoYou can add thumbnail images to your posts in two steps. First, make sure the thumbnail is enabled in the theme’s configuration file:READMOME: <!-- more -->article: thumbnail: trueThen, provide an URL or path to the image file in the front-matter of your post: title: Getting Started with Icarus thumbnail: /gallery/thumbnails/desert.jpgPost content…About thumbnail image pathThe image path you put in the front-matter needs to be the relative path to the source directory of your website. For example, if you want to use the following image as a thumbnail: 1/source/gallery/image.jpgYou need to use the following as the image path: 1/gallery/image.jpgAlso, it is recommended that you put all the images under a dedicated asset folder that is separated from the _posts folder. test text
